clinical_study.brief_title: White Matter Hyperintensities Burden in Adult Patients With Cyanotic Congenital Heart Disease: a Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of White Matter Hyperintensities Burden in Adult Patients With Cyanotic Congenital Heart Disease: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims at investigating the role of cyanotic congenital heart disease (cCHD) on brain aging. The investigators assume that due to congenital and acquired cardiovascular abnormalities, cCHD patients could show radiologic (and clinical) signs of precocious brain aging and eventual cognitive decline.

detailed_description.textblock: White matter hyperintensities burden will be quantified through a semi-autamated software (ITK-SNAP)

primary_outcome.measure: White matter hyperintensities volume expressed in mm^3

intervention.description: Acquisition of 3D T1-weighted, 3D FLAIR and GRE brain MRI scans

reference.citation: Yushkevich PA, Piven J, Hazlett HC, Smith RG, Ho S, Gee JC, Gerig G. User-guided 3D active contour segmentation of anatomical structures: significantly improved efficiency and reliability. Neuroimage. 2006 Jul 1;31(3):1116-28. Epub 2006 Mar 20.
